John, thanks for the nice explanation of image enlargment, something I
knew little about!  One thing that may be a challenge in this domain
is the high number of inputs and outputs.  The problem, which comes up
often with NEAT, is that starting out with a large number of of inputs
and outputs means starting with a very large number of starting
connections, and hence violating the spirit of the principle of
starting minimally.  Thus, it may be necessary to start evolution in a
more sophisticated way, such as letting NEAT decide which inputs
and/or outputs to use, or perhaps using an "eye" like Darren Izzard
(in this group) did.  The main concern is that if you start out with
too many connections to begin with, you don't get the full power of
NEAT, which is meant to start in a low-dimensional space.

ken
